db:abstract.db:para: The QJsonArray class encapsulates a JSON array.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QJsonArray is part of JSON Support in QtImplicitly Shared Classes

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A JSON array is a list of values. The list can be manipulated by inserting and removing QJsonValue's from the array.

A QJsonArray can be converted to and from a QVariantList. You can query the number of entries with size(), insert(), and removeAt() entries from it and iterate over its content using the standard C++ iterator pattern.
QJsonArray is an implicitly shared class and shares the data with the document it has been created from as long as it is not being modified.
You can convert the array to and from text based JSON through QJsonDocument.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::ConstIterator
db:section.db:para: Qt-style synonym for QJsonArray::const_iterator.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::Iterator
db:section.db:para: Qt-style synonym for QJsonArray::iterator.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::const_pointer
db:section.db:para: Typedef for const QJsonValue *. Provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::const_reference
db:section.db:para: Typedef for const QJsonValue &. Provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::difference_type
db:section.db:para: Typedef for int. Provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::pointer
db:section.db:para: Typedef for QJsonValue *. Provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::reference
db:section.db:para: Typedef for QJsonValue &. Provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::size_type
db:section.db:para: Typedef for int. Provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::value_type
db:section.db:para: Typedef for QJsonValue. Provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::QJsonArray()
db:section.db:para: Creates an empty array.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.4] QJsonArray::QJsonArray(int args)
db:section.db:para: Creates an array initialized from args initialization list.
QJsonArray can be constructed in a way similar to JSON notation, for example:
This function was introduced in Qt 5.4.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::QJsonArray(const QJsonArray &other)
db:section.db:para: Creates a copy of other.
Since QJsonArray is implicitly shared, the copy is shallow as long as the object doesn't get modified.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QJsonArray::~QJsonArray()
db:section.db:para: Deletes the array.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::append(const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Inserts value at the end of the array.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue QJsonArray::at(int i) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a QJsonValue representing the value for index i.
The returned QJsonValue is Undefined, if i is out of bounds.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::iterator QJsonArray::begin()
db:section.db:para: Returns an STL-style iterator pointing to the first item in the array.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::const_iterator QJsonArray::begin() const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::const_iterator QJsonArray::constBegin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style iterator pointing to the first item in the array.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::const_iterator QJsonArray::constEnd() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style iterator pointing to the imaginary item after the last item in the array.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonArray::contains(const QJsonValue &value) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the array contains an occurrence of value, otherwise false.

db:section.db:title: int QJsonArray::count() const
db:section.db:para: Same as size().

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonArray::empty() const
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for STL compatibility. It is equivalent to isEmpty() and returns true if the array is empty.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::iterator QJsonArray::end()
db:section.db:para: Returns an STL-style iterator pointing to the imaginary item after the last item in the array.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::const_iterator QJsonArray::end() const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::iterator QJsonArray::erase(QJsonArray::iterator it)
db:section.db:para: Removes the item pointed to by it, and returns an iterator pointing to the next item.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue QJsonArray::first() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the first value stored in the array.
Same as at(0).

db:section.db:title: [static] QJsonArray QJsonArray::fromStringList(const QStringList &list)
db:section.db:para: Converts the string list list to a QJsonArray.
The values in list will be converted to JSON values.

db:section.db:title: [static] QJsonArray QJsonArray::fromVariantList(const QVariantList &list)
db:section.db:para: Converts the variant list list to a QJsonArray.
The QVariant values in list will be converted to JSON values.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray::iterator QJsonArray::insert(QJsonArray::iterator before, const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Inserts value before the position pointed to by before, and returns an iterator pointing to the newly inserted item.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::insert(int i, const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Inserts value at index position i in the array. If i is 0, the value is prepended to the array. If i is size(), the value is appended to the array.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonArray::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the object is empty. This is the same as size() == 0.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue QJsonArray::last() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the last value stored in the array.
Same as at(size() - 1).

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::pop_back()
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for STL compatibility. It is equivalent to removeLast(). The array must not be empty. If the array can be empty, call isEmpty() before calling this function.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::pop_front()
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for STL compatibility. It is equivalent to removeFirst(). The array must not be empty. If the array can be empty, call isEmpty() before calling this function.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::prepend(const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Inserts value at the beginning of the array.
This is the same as insert(0, value) and will prepend value to the array.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::push_back(const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for STL compatibility. It is equivalent to append(value) and will append value to the array.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::push_front(const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for STL compatibility. It is equivalent to prepend(value) and will prepend value to the array.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::removeAt(int i)
db:section.db:para: Removes the value at index position i. i must be a valid index position in the array (i.e., 0 <= i < size()).

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::removeFirst()
db:section.db:para: Removes the first item in the array. Calling this function is equivalent to calling removeAt(0). The array must not be empty. If the array can be empty, call isEmpty() before calling this function.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::removeLast()
db:section.db:para: Removes the last item in the array. Calling this function is equivalent to calling removeAt(size() - 1). The array must not be empty. If the array can be empty, call isEmpty() before calling this function.

db:section.db:title: void QJsonArray::replace(int i, const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Replaces the item at index position i with value. i must be a valid index position in the array (i.e., 0 <= i < size()).

db:section.db:title: int QJsonArray::size() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of values stored in the array.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue QJsonArray::takeAt(int i)
db:section.db:para: Removes the item at index position i and returns it. i must be a valid index position in the array (i.e., 0 <= i < size()).
If you don't use the return value, removeAt() is more efficient.

db:section.db:title: QVariantList QJsonArray::toVariantList() const
db:section.db:para: Converts this object to a QVariantList.
Returns the created map.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonArray::operator!=(const QJsonArray &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this array is not equal to other.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] QJsonArray QJsonArray::operator+(const QJsonValue &value) const
db:section.db:para: Returns an array that contains all the items in this array followed by the provided value.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] QJsonArray &QJsonArray::operator+=(const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Appends value to the array, and returns a reference to the array itself.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] QJsonArray &QJsonArray::operator<<(const QJsonValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Appends value to the array, and returns a reference to the array itself.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray &QJsonArray::operator=(const QJsonArray &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns other to this array.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonArray::operator==(const QJsonArray &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this array is equal to other.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValueRef QJsonArray::operator[](int i)
db:section.db:para: Returns the value at index position i as a modifiable reference. i must be a valid index position in the array (i.e., 0 <= i < size()).

The return value is of type QJsonValueRef, a helper class for QJsonArray and QJsonObject. When you get an object of type QJsonValueRef, you can use it as if it were a reference to a QJsonValue. If you assign to it, the assignment will apply to the character in the QJsonArray of QJsonObject from which you got the reference.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue QJsonArray::operator[](int i) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Same as at().
